3.  TERM

The initial term of this Agreement shall be for a period of one (1) year from the Effective Date unless sooner terminated pursuant to the termination provisions herein. Thereafter, this Agreement automatically renews for successive terms of one (1) year.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.  TERM

The initial term of this Agreement shall be for a period of one (1) year from the Effective Date unless sooner terminated pursuant to the termination provisions herein. Thereafter, this Agreement may renew for successive terms of one (1) year, subject to mutual written agreement by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement 'automatically renews,' while the modified version introduces 'subject to mutual written agreement,' creating a contradiction. One implies automatic renewal, while the other requires active agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 8.3 Each party agrees that for a period of three (3) years following the disclosure of Confidential Information, it (a) will not use, directly or indirectly, or reproduce the Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except in accordance with the terms of the Agreement, (b) will not disclose the Confidential Information of the other party to any third parties except as expressly permitted in this Agreement, and (c) will take all reasonable security measures to maintain the confidentiality of all Confidential Information of the other party in its possession or control, which will in no event be less than the measures it uses to maintain the confidentiality of its own information of similar importance.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.3 Each party agrees that for a period of one (1) year following the disclosure of Confidential Information, it (a) will not use, directly or indirectly, or reproduce the Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except in accordance with the terms of the Agreement, (b) will not disclose the Confidential Information of the other party to any third parties except as expressly permitted in this Agreement, and (c) will take all reasonable security measures to maintain the confidentiality of all Confidential Information of the other party in its possession or control, which will in no event be less than the measures it uses to maintain the confidentiality of its own information of similar importance.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an internal conflict with Section 8.4, which stipulates that confidentiality obligations survive termination for three years, this change reduces the time frame mentioned in 8.3 to one year.

perturbation.changed_text:
10.   LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTY

10.1 IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, PUNITIVE, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, NOR FOR ANY DAMAGES RELATING TO LOST DATA, LOST PROFITS, ADVERTISING OR PROMOTIONAL COSTS, TERMINATION OF EMPLOYEES, SALARIES OF EMPLOYEES OR SEVERANCE PAYMENTS, CREATION OF CUSTOMER BASE, OR FUTURE EXPECTATIONS OR OTHER ECONOMIC ADVANTAGE, HOWSOEVER ARISING AND REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, WARRANTY OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR UNDER ANY OTHER THEORY OF LIABILITY IN LAW OR IN EQUITY, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies an exception for breaches of Section 8 (Confidentiality). By removing this exception, the modified text implies that even for breaches of confidentiality, the limitation of liability applies. This directly contradicts the original intent, creating uncertainty about the consequences of breaching confidentiality.
